speaker: Rob
content: is superset instructions. Which again, very standard in traditional VMs.

speaker: Rob
content: Where, hey, if I see this particular set of instructions repeating a lot,

speaker: Rob
content: I combine that into a single instruction, which makes execution faster, it makes CPU usage, etc., faster.

speaker: Rob
content: I mean, for example, every single

speaker: Rob
content: ERC20 transfer, right? They go through a few opcodes. They go through an S read and then they go through a write and then they normally go through another read and then there's a check or something.

speaker: Rob
content: Condense that into one line item and all of a sudden, you know, that's that's three times the overhead on DB access, and right access, and all of those things that you remove.

content: Um, again, huge performance increase there. And, and the two biggest things going into, okay.
